intro: Plagiobothrys scriptus, commonly known as the script-like filaree, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are opposite and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are arranged in clusters. Plagiobothrys scriptus is a short-lived perennial that thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed or sunny environments.
